intro: Agraphis campanulata, commonly known as the bell-shaped agraphis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has hairy, upright stems with narrow leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster that resembles a bell, giving it its common name. Agraphis campanulata is often found in open habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
